Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location, and a fabulous staff even during Hurricane Isaac”
Reviews.Author: difrancescolynne
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is located on Frenchman Street where all the best music in New Orleans is being played. The tiny street is dotted with some amazing no cover jazz clubs that are truly unbelievable!! Now the hotel....very charming! Old, yes, but that is one of the reasons you come to New Orleans in my opinion. The room was well appointed and clean. There is a beautiful courtyard with a pool and a hot tub and a roof top deck. Ok....I saved the best for last....THE STAFF!!!!!!!!!! We were just there during Hurricane Isaac, yes Hurricane Isaac! Right before the storm started one of the staff members (cant remember names darn it) told us he was concerned about one of the windows in our room, so he moved us to a beautiful suite...Nice. When the storm hit naturally the hotel, along with most of New Orleans, lost power. Now, while this is totally out of their control, it is a bummer, because New Orleans is very hot and humid in August. What the staff did during this time was above and beyond anything I have ever experienced. First of all, they had the fire station across the street make coffee for us every morning. Next they had stocked up on food, water, and supplies for their guests. They even provided a barbecue for us including hurricane drinks the night of the big event. And, drum roll please, when we checked out 3 days later than our originally scheduled departure we found out they had comp'd us the 3 additional days!!!!!! They had been running around ragged to try to please us during a hurricane, and still they charged us nothing for our additional stay. Kudos to the entire staff at The Frenchman Hotel...We will be back!!!!!!!!!!!!! The DiFrancesco Family

Reviews.Title: “Quaint lovely place - Better than Bourbon Street!”
Reviews.Author: lawgirl0331
Reviews.Content: love this place - the staff was wonderful, and when the air didn't work in the first room, they quickly moved us. Yes it's a little older,and not a five star turn down place but we felt very well taken care of - they helped us get discounts at attractions, and even called a cab when I got stuck after visiting a museum, I just called the hotel and told them where I was and they sent a cab right to me - now THAT is service!

Reviews.Title: “The Frenchmen Hotel is my new home while in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Flfitguy
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The location is phenomenal! Frenchmen street is where it is definitely happening. I have been traveling to NOLA for 20 years and always do the Bourbon street thing. I was so tired of Bourbon, and I wanted something different and exciting. Frenchmen street is it! Stay at the Frenchmen Hotel! You can still walk to bourbon and do everything there or just chill out on Bourbon street. I read a review that said if you're a Hilton or Marriot snob...stay out! I agree...This place is about the architecture and the Frenchmen street experience. Troy and kenisha both work at the front desk. They will assist you in anyway they can.

Reviews.Title: “Charming New Orleans style with comfort.”
Reviews.Author: DSBJD
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit New Orleans during our family road trip. When we arrived in the city our tedious search for a reasonable and clean hotel began. Since we were traveling with 3 young children many of the major hotel chains wanted to charge us for a suite averaging $180 or higher. If we found a hotel with decent reviews that was affordable, they were booked. The Frenchmen cost us $120 for the night and they did not care about us having 3 children. Another bonus was the parking which was included in the above price. Our car was secure and unlike the others was the cheapest price quoted to us. Our children were excitted, as was I. The room was colorful, clean, nicely furnished and spacious for us all. The full sized beds were smaller then we were used to BUT they were the most comfortable we have stayed in yet. The best part must have been the pool and hot tub. Since we arrived late, lost an hour do to time change and it took us an hour to find a place, I had lost hope in us doing anything fun that evening. However, we had a night swim in the cozy pool that was open till 11 pm while enjoying the jazz music from the neighboring bars. Our children had a blast. I was actually sad to go and after visiting 4 hotels on our trip through 9 states the Frenchmen was my favorite. I would love to come back and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. It made our New Orleans trip memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: behindeverycloud
Reviews.Content: My disabled mother accompanied me on a business trip and the staff was amazing to both of us. When we arrived a handicapped parking space was there for us. Everytime I left in my car for the day, the hotel staff saved the spot. The ladies at the desk and the housekeeping staff were friendly and incredible. Great night life just around the corner. Charming rooms and very clean. I would not stay anywhere else in NOLO.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: noles2u
Reviews.Content: If you are a Marriott / Hilton snob, this is not the place for you. But, if you are wanting the nawlins' experience at its finest, they you are in for a treat. Frenchmen Street is home to the blues. We were able to walk a block from our hotel and sit and enjoy adult beverages and live music every night we were in NO, six in all. Jackson Square is a mere six blocks away, and if you are at all familiar with the French Quarter, a block is only 1/10th of a mile, so the entire quarter is within easy striking distance, including affordable restaurants and bars. We had the teeny tiny room located right off the main courtyard and found it quite charming. Let's face it, if you plan on staying in your room, why go to New Orleans in the first place. We too had partiers but we handled it in a calm manner - we went outside and joined them for a few minutes and chatted and consumed an adult beverage with them. When we parted, telling them we were heading to bed, they quieted down and we slept like babies. Our room was clean. The wet wash cloth on the tile floor test yielded a clean washcloth. Bed linen was crisp and fresh smelling. Housekeeping staff was very accommodating, so much so, we came back from a day in the quarter to find clean towels hanging on the door, the staff having honored our do not disturb. I will tell you the only serious shortcoming we noted - there is no elevator, so if you are not in good shape you will not like dealing with luggage. Unfortunately the hotel does not employ a bellperson. Oh, I forgot - you are only two blocks to the end stop of the riverfront trolley, which will take you all the way to Riverfront and the Harrah's Casino on Canal Street - $3 per day. Will definitely put The Frenchmen on my short list for my next trip to Nawlins.

Reviews.Title: “A place that screams quirky Naw'lins.”
Reviews.Author: T R
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here. You can not beat the value nor the location. We love the personality of the place. It is clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We have driven both times, so the secure parking is a plus. If you love the blues, Frenchmen street is the place to be. Everything is right up the street. Also, the French Quarter is walkable from here, and a street car stop is within an easy stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: CSS2009
Reviews.Content: Our teeny tiny room was located right off the main courtyard, and we didn't get a moments sleep. Other hotel guests congregated right outside our door all night long, and we were kept awake by loud partiers on their way in and out of the hotel.The hotel is well situated, but in addition to the in house noise, the place across the street blared music to all hours. We were in NO for the Jazz Festival, so we are not anti revelry, but the constant barrage was too much for us. I pride myself on being an adventurous traveler, but we ended up moving after 2 nights to the Sheraton on Canal Street, and despite not being refunded our last 2 nights, we were thrilled. The room was large and QUIET. Next time I will know better.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon on a budget”
Reviews.Author: klinkker
Reviews.Content: This is where my husband and I stayed for a week on our honeymoon. We got married at the Algiers Courthouse across the river. It was such a wonderful experience. We are huge coffee freaks. We love going to the coffee houses and just lounging about. We were on a small budget and I wouldn't change a thing. The rooms are small but, very comfortable. It was very New Orleans "Old". Very cute. Just an example of how old this place is.. We tried to park our truck in the parking area right under the hotel.. We ended up scratching the hell out of the side of the truck because it wouldn't fit into the old carriage way. Our truck is nearly 30 years old so.. as long as it still ran, we were just fine. We pointed towards the parking area of their sister hotel. All was right with the world and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time....even if it did rain”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler50
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews have stated, it is indeed quaint and charming and very well kept. I did not expect a large room but it was fine even if I did spend more time in it then the average visitor because of the weather. Yes, I heard music from the clubs on the street but it was not so loud as to stop me from falling asleep. Yes, some of the guests were loud at 4AM which did wake me up but only for a few minutes. For a hotel just on the other side of the French Quarter this place is a gem. I can't say enough about the people on the front desk. They were all friendly and seemed to have pride in their jobs The housekeeping staff always had my room ready no mater what time I returned to it. The only semi-negative thing is that the area is a little funky and aimed at a younger crowd however, this 65 year old had a great time and would certainly stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Customer service lives!”
Reviews.Author: MissMag00
Reviews.Content: After a very confusing and sad experience at the B&B we had booked in, we needed a different place to stay -- and right quick. Even though when I called the front desk Khanesha was busy assisting customers checking out, I briefly explained our situation and she told us to come right over -- they will find us a room, if not there, then somewhere! Well, we ended up staying at the Frenchmen and Khanesha was so understanding and it was such a relief to have a friendly experience after our previous nightmare night at the B&B. We stayed in a queen room overlooking the pool, it was quiet and comfortable. These are not luxury rooms, but they are comfortable, clean, exceptionally priced and in the absolute perfect location -- bordering the Marigny and the quarter. There is a security code to get in, and always someone at the front desk so we felt safe. When we checked out we had Khanesha again and she was again super friendly and helpful, again apologizing for something that wasn't even her fault at the B&B down the street! She told us she hoped it didn't reflect poorly on the city. We love New Orleans and plan to come back again and again - and will definitely stay at the Frenchmen when we do!

Reviews.Title: “authentic New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: acorniv
Reviews.Content: My family (with a 6 and 10 yo) stayed in this hotel a number of years ago (not 2011 - tripadvisor wouldn't let me enter earlier). It was so memorable that I'm taking the time to review it now. When we travel, we always look for small, one owner places that have an authentic regional feel. We're willing to give up other amenities for this. My kids, especially my daughter (a life long Martha Stewart fan), loved the quaintness and relaxed elegance of this place, and didn't even care that the pool wasn't available (it was unheated then; you'll want to ask in advance) in November. The staff was friendly and the rooms were comfortable, the way visiting a favorite relative is comfortable - just shabby enough to feel homey. The downside was the ancient parking garage, which required more strategy than I possess to park in. Some of you will love it, but for the claustrophobic non-professional driver, it's a challenging experience. Not for SUV 's. OTOH how many small hotels in NO have their own parking lots? And it was very secure, which counts for a lot in this sity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: jenjenjenio
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here. We arrived a few hours before check-in time, but they allowed us to leave our bags while we walked around the city, and they also put us at the top of the list to have our room cleaned first. We asked for a place to get breakfast, and the recommendation was awesome. There were only four employees watching the front door, so you get to know them pretty quickly. The room itself was a decent size, and we didn't have any issues with changes in water temperature like other reviewers mentioned. The outside music was a little loud, but I slept fine after long days of non-stop walking! I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Rvblanc
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was very small, yes you cannot open the window - only the door if you want fresh air, yes there was a crack in the shower tray, but ! The staff was very nice, the room was very clean, it's charming and so well located ! We will go back !

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Wonderful-ness”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Frenchmen Hotel for 5 days ( April 3rd-April 8th) with about 25 friends and family members renting all different kinds of rooms. We had our wedding reception on the roof top terrace! We cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The queen loft was so perfect and accommodated our family of 4 perfectly. I got to see all the rooms while stopping by the familiesâ€™ rooms, and I love them all clean, unique and fun. Our whole family was happy with all the hotel rooms. We also spend a lot of time gathering in the court yard, using the hot tub, and the pool. The rooms were great but the staff was Wonderful!! We had many, many unexpected needs come up for the wedding reception and throughout the days and everyone from the sales director to the front door receptionist and the cleaning staff were SO, SO helpful!! More than once going above and beyond what anyone was expecting to help. The noise never kept us awake. and we even switched rooms one night with my mother-in-law who had the balcony room facing Frenchmen St.. Jazz Music in the air!!! I love it. I normally stay with family while in New Orleans but this lovely hotel makes me want stay here all the time, and be close to all the action! We loved Frenchman St. and ate several times in the area, The Praline Connection was good, Snug Harbor, fun. Although, Motitoâ€™s was not great. Everything was so close. I can't wait to stay here again for our 1 year anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel: Bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: CamilleNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I was serious about earplugs. Even from a room in the back of the hotel, we could hear the music on the street. OTHER THAN THAT, this is a charming, clean, historic hotel with a dining room table for the guests to share for breakfast. The people are interesting and the food is small. But, when you spend the day eating everything in sight, a small breakfast is a good thing. Our room #202 was comfortable, had furniture with large drawers so we could unpack, and a bathroom with a shower. The bed was good, the pillows good and the windows worked. But, we could hear someone practicing the tuba in the middle of the night. One night, there was a horrendous thunder storm (OK, who could help that?) and no one slept a wink. Buy earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Sam L
Reviews.Content: The room was so small that we had to get dressed on the bed. Rooms are tacky and smell like citrus windex. Seems like there's a history of double-booking rooms. Location is cool, and there is a small pool...slightly larger than the rooms. Same price as the swanky French Quarter rooms, so you're probably better off booking out there. Walls are thin, bring earplugs if you wanna sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Louise H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Frenchmen during Mardi Gras (room 106). What a great hotel! It's very charming and quaint (not unlike an inn or B&B) - the antique furniture and french doors really add character and the bed was very comfortable! The front desk staff were all very friendly, especially Troy, and when we mentioned a few problems with our room (toilet constantly running and a little leak in the ceiling), John, one of the maintenance guys, came in right away to look at and fix the issues. The location of this hotel is great - just far enough from the French Quarter to avoid the hustle and bustle of that neighborhood, but close enough that it's within walking distance (approximately 15-20 minute walk). Frenchmen Street can be quite noisy at night as the jazz clubs are open til all hours of the night. Bring earplugs and you'll be fine. The continental breakfast was good: bagels, toast, donuts, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea, orange juice, milk and king cake. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute complications turned into a blessing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie E
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for another place 7 months prior to our arrival. Upon our arrival, our room was given away even though we were told there was a "plumbing issue" in the room & given a substandard room that was unacceptable. I called around all over New Orleans & surrounding areas (during Mardi Gras, mind you) & happened upon this little gem called the Frenchman Hotel. Super friendly & accomodating staff. Clean, bright, & cheerful property. One of the BEST locations. We had such an amazing time that we inquired about next year! We will be back & we definitely will be staying @ the Frenchmen!!!!! Superthanks to Clarence, Troy, & Ashley! You guys are WONDERFUL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “frenchmen street getaway”
Reviews.Author: loco dog
Reviews.Content: Reminiscence of the family hotels of France. Convenient to the music scene. Safe neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “A good fit for you?”
Reviews.Author: Quietness
Reviews.Content: Highlights: traditional architecture and excellent service. Low point: noise from loud music nearby. The buildings have a real old New Orleans feel: tall windows, a courtyard, a pool (sort of like a fountain) in the middle of the courtyard. Lovely. As for service, we don't usually make a lot of requests, but for some reason we had several unusual needs on this trip. The staff was always professional and very helpful. Kudos! Another plus: good coffee in the lobby all day. Concerning noise, the Frenchman Street music clubs were not bad, but there was a bar with very loud amps on touristy Decatur Street, right around the corner, as well as music in the outdoor restaurant next door. Our room was near the back of the hotel, but we could still hear both. So, whether you like this place will depend on whether you mind the sounds. The room itself was mostly fine. Very comfortable bed; bathroom fixtures were not the latest, but they worked, and we're fine with that. Possible improvements would include a second chair, another shelf in the bathroom, and hooks for bathrobes.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Tired”
Reviews.Author: maw11
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter visited New Orleans from December 23rd to December 26th. We stayed at the Frenchmen inn. It was my wife and my 4th time staying at Frenchmen inn, our first with our young daughter. In the past we have stayed in smaller rooms and only used the hotel to sleep and refresh ourselves, as we spent most of our time enjoying the quarters nightlife. We booked a 1-bedroom suite. We stayed in room 301 on the second floor over looking Frenchmen Street. The room was large and we had a balcony. The furnishings are very tired. The pull out sofa was useless as the mattress springs are coming through. The kitchen is ill equipped. The bathroom is dated and was lacking a tub stopper at check in. the whole hotel is in need of repair. There were very little festive decorations. We went out and purchased lights and decorations for our balcony. Every other hotel seemed much more festive and magical. Upon check in we requested some tips and bookings for sight seeing and restaurants. We would get bits of information but never any answers or suggested bookings. We did everything on our own, booking through the Internet when it was functioning, which was not very often. In fairness, we spent more time in our room, then we initial thought as it rained and was cold during our stay. We thought of staying an extra day when we first arrived but after viewing the room, and realizing this is not a city for a young child when the weather isnâ€™t favorable we decided to move on. We chose New Orleans as our destination because we realize they need help at the present but very disappointed in the city over the holidays and the hotel. I donâ€™t think we will be back to the Frenchmen Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: OK, so you want a hotel room for a few nights and the Frenchmen sounds good, here's a checklist for you, just so you know what to expect: 1 Are you over 5ft 9inches? If your answer is yes, you're screwed. The beds in these place are designed for leprechauns and other vertically challenged folk. Quite simply the smallest bed in America... possibly the whole world. 2 Are you used to sleeping under bright lights? If your answer is "no", you're screwed as the hotel leaves all the exterior lights on all night (eco friendly it ain't) which floods the rooms with 'Close Encounters' stylee lighting which is about as conducive to sleep as a pot of coffee. 3 Like sleeping on rubber? If your answer is no, jog on buddy... the bed sheets are such poor quality that every time you move they roll up, exposing the rubber mattress underneath which stick to your skin. Lovely on those clammy NO nights! 4 Wanna hot shower? Well this ain't the place to be buddy. Nope, no hot water in this 'bargain' joint... Freezin' cold and lots of it. In summary: Pretty little boutique hotel that seems to be perfect until you actually experience it up close. Worst night's sleep for $100 I've ever had. The ONLY saving grace is that the reception staff are very nice. Jog on... seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Beleive The Good Reviews. This Is A Dump.”
Reviews.Author: newjade
Reviews.Content: My wife an I booked this place based on a quick check on Tripadvisor, for a lay over on our way home from Texas. based on the overwhelming good reviews, and the fact that we wanted to stay close to Frenchmen St., we booked this hotel. Upon our arrival, it was obvious that what they show on their web page and what you get are two separate things. This place should be in the worst places in America to stay. It comes complete with cockroaches crawling on the floor. The place is old and not in very good repair. The room is so small that there is no chair or table in the room, so there is no where in the room to set down except on the bed. The mattress on the bed is soft and lumpy as are the pillows. The bathroom, once again is so small there is not even a counter to set anything down on. The floor in the bathroom and shower has been painted over in an attempt to cover up the mold, but the paint is peeling off exposing the mold under the paint. The air conditioner never did get the room comfortable, even though it ran all night. To top all this off, I received a call to come home early, as my elderly mother had gotten sick and had to be put in the hospital. When we informed them that we would be checking out the next morning, no mention was made that we would be charged the entire stay. The normal is that you can cancel with a days notice, which we gave them, but they say they have a 10 day cancel policy. Since I have returned, I have checked the other reviewers that have gave this place such glowing reviews. If you are considering booking this place, I suggest that you do the same before booking. This place needs to be put out of business. It is a health hazard, as well as practicing unethical business practices. If you would like to see actual photos of the rooms, email me and I will send them to you.

Reviews.Title: “A REAL Taste Of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: RCC_LBC
Reviews.Content: Can't beat it for the price. Excellent location, friendly staff (special thanks Jessica!), and all around great service in general. It is a true New Orleans experience, so if being just a number in a generic highrise hotel is your "comfort zone" then book a room at one of the corporate hotels on Canal Street. I am afraid that the charms of The Frenchmen may be lost on you. But if you want a real taste of New Orelean this is the place. It is a converted home so all rooms are different and full of character. Continental breakfast in the mornings. Small pool with a mini hot tub. Friendly staff who are eager to assist you. All make for a great experience. It's only downfall is also one of its strong points, in that it is located on Frenchmen Street which is THE PLACE to go for live music. It is very noisey and the live music from the local jazz clubs plays well into the night. (Remember, there is really no "last call" in New Orleans). So if you are the type of person that likes to retire early (in New Orleans?,,,thats just crazy!) and/or is a light sleeper...this may not be the best spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted out of New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: alee01
Reviews.Content: The Frenchman is a fun and eccentric spot in a super fun part of New Orleans. While there we had some of the most amazing meals all within a few blocks from the hotel. Our carriage tour guide said Frenchman st is where the locals like to hang out and I can see why. Tons of great Jazz bars and fun without fighting the insanity of Bourbon. Still close enough to walk to Bourbon for fun and people watching. Staff was helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and everything was in great working order. For my husband and I it was a wonderful place to stay, maybe not as ideal for those with young kids due to the music from the bars playing till late at night. Make sure you ask staff about the GREAT places to eat in the immediate area. Our favorite was Adolfo's!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lalalikestotravel
Reviews.Content: So my stay at this hotel was actually great! My husband and I stayed here along with another couple. Our friends were in the room next door. The staff was very accomodating when there was a mix up with our room, and the location was ideal for our trip. BUT, when I got home I discovered that I had a couple of bug bites. No big deal, I've had bug bites before. But then the next morning I had dozens of bites all over my body! I knew right away what it was, bed bugs! My friend had found what she thought was a bed bug in the shower the first night we were there. I shrugged it off, but now I know that is what it was. When I discovered the bites, I called my friend to see if she had any. Sure enough, she was also covered in bug bites! my friend and I live in completely different states, so there is no other option than that these bites came from this hotel!!! I'm sorry to write this review because we did enjoy our stay but I feel I need to warn anyone who is going to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: zeppo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Frenchmen in September, based on a recommendation from a friend. I love the area around the Marigny--great music clubs and bars, and without the 24 hour madness of Bourbon Street. Of course Bourbon Street is a quick and safe 10 minute walk. The hotel is old, funky, and the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, and the price quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Nola!”
Reviews.Author: Posers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Frenchmen hotel September 17-21. It is a very cute hotel that reminds me of a Bed&Breakfast. It is in a great location, end on French Quoter and in walking distance to every famous street, you want to visit. If you can, try to book a room that faces the courtyard - it is a pretty view on the pool and hot tub and very quiet. The street itself ( The Frenchmen street) has lots of bars and they play loud music until, probably, 1am, after that it is quiet. We had NO problem with any kind of noise because we didn't plan to be in NOLA and go to bed before midnight! It is so much fun to walk on the street around midnight, watch great crowd, artists selling their stuff, listen to different kind of music, can't imagine people complaining about the noise -it is part of fun vacation. Once again, after 1am, it is very quiet and peaceful. There is a bar next door, called MOJITO. What a great place! They have a fabulous Sunday brunch with live jazz and absolutely the best french toast, socked in creme-brulet and served with berries - MUST HAVE!!!! We were finishing our day every night at Mojito's, sipping our beer, listening great music, dancing and watching people! Awesome place! The hotel has a breakfast that is basically just coffee, donuts and some fruits but there are tons of places around within 3-5 walking minutes to have breakfast. Our favorite was the coffee shop Envy - the best breakfast in town and 5 minutes from the hotel! French Market is within 5 minutes from the hotel, also. Lots of fun and great place for souvenirs and some drinks. You will be 5 minutes walk from the river and street cars, 10 mins from Bourbon street and 15 mins - from Canal street. I mean, location of that little hotel is amazing! We enjoyed a horse carriage tour - highly recommended - so much fun and so much history! They will stop by the oldest bar in Nola and the best Hurricanes in town. The waiter will walk to your carriage and you can order your drinks right on the street. That bar was the only bar open 24/7 during Katrina. The only disappointment for us was that the hot tub in the hotel was broken. Hopefully it will be fixed before you get there, we were thinking how cool would be to sit in the hot tub every night because we did lots of walking :) The bed in our room was very soft and squishy. I'm sure it is a great bed for lots of people but we love very firm mattress, so that was not our best bed. Just want to mention that for people like us, who can't really rest on a soft bed. Be aware of people approaching you on the street with tricky questions ( "I can tell you where you got these shoes on?") and don't ask people on a street for direction - they will ask you to pay them. Get a map, talk to the receptionist in the hotel - The French Quarter is very easy to navigate so , if you have a map, you can get anywhere on your own :) You will see lots of young people with dogs who will ask you a dollar for dogs food - don't fall for that. If you really are an animal lover, get some dogs food in a sandwich bag and hand it to them - this way you will know the dog will get food, not the owner - a beer :) The receptionist in the hotel is there 24/7 so no matter what time you are back, they will always let you in and you feel secure and safe. We got there 2 hours early and they let us in the room without any problems. The staff is very nice and friendly, rooms are small and clean, a bit outdated but everything you need, is there. We will absolutely stay there next time! Email me with any additional questions.

Reviews.Title: “Love Frenchmen Street”
Reviews.Author: amyaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very New Orleans- it's laid back, a little rough around the edges, friendly and full of good times. It's almost like staying at your old eccentric aunt's house. I believe that Frenchmen Street is one of the most amazing streets in the world and it will not stay this way forever. Many of the music venues are cover free and full of amazing performances- we saw a band battle on the corner of a street where two bands fought for the rights to the corner with music. Now for the hotel- we stayed in I believe it was room 210- back in the corner- it was a little dark, the floor was sticky- king sized bed- old furniture. There were rolling beds et all stored in the hall corner. My friend had sent a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. It was in the room on ice. We took it to the pool which serves as the heart of the establishment. The pool is tiny and in the summer- everyone hangs out there- all night. It's NO and there are just less restrictions. Fun for those that like to hang out late but maybe not so fun for those that want a quieter experience. Now- this didn't really bother us but I could see someone else getting upset- one day before we were going out- brushing our teeth in the bathroom sink- a rubber pipe below it detached and started squirting water all over the room. We told the front desk and they had the handyman come. The problem was bigger than anyone realized and they moved us to a suite. The suite was significantly cleaner and nicer than the regular room- but it was funky as well. Bed is in an upstairs loft- no tv- downstairs to bedroom - seperate ac upstairs to keep it cool. Downstairs has couch, tv, closet, bathroom, nice patio with view of pool. The "breakfast" is pretty standard cheap hotel continental- with instant grits available of course. My husband helped a worker move some heavy furniture and they gave us a bottle of cheap bubbly. I thought that was very nice. You walk out the door and find Frenchmen in all its glory. There may be people making out on car roofs, trumpets being played while walking, drunken ridiculousness, people dressed to the 9s and homeless squatter kids as well as neighboorhood people selling bbq and vegetarian burritos. I imagine Frenchmen is what Bourbon St. was like 100 years ago before it lost all of its goodness and turned into trash. It is amazing- particularly during the week- Sat. not as much. I love New Orleans as it is special and not like any other place in the country- this is good in some ways and inconvenient in others. This character makes me love it even more but I can see how others would not like it or understand it. The Frenchmen is very much a character-filled NO establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Esther004
Reviews.Content: The room was facing the street with two double glass doors! We never slept the entire trip, One employee sit on the step to the doors and was fighting with her boyfriend. Drunks walk by all night long, talking very loudly. The dead roach was really discusting, and never cleaned up by the staff. And, the breakfast glazed doughnuts! WOW! Loved New Orleans, just stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great city and lots to see and do”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeTraveler55
Reviews.Content: The Frenchmen Hotel is located on Frenchmen Street which is surrounded by night life. Kenesha a manager at the hotel and is so sweet and helpful. Eat at Adolph's is a must. Great food, not costly but small. So get there early. Lots of bars to hear music and dance all night. The area is loads of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Bad beds.”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaGreg
Reviews.Content: The location was fine. But the fold out sofa and the cots were THE MOST UNCOMFORTABLE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. I am not a high maintenance traveler; but these mattresses were so uncomfortable, even our 6 and 7 year old kids couldn't sleep on them. Literally, you could take the mattress and squeeze with your hands and it compressed down to about 1/16th of an inch. We asked that something be done, and they brought up another cot and a bottle of champagne. The new cot was exactly the same. I'd say that the rooms are fine if you only get a single room. But don't expect to sleep on the cots or fold out sofas. Hate to speak poorly of the hotel because they did make some effort to satisfy us. But keeping those beds is a tremendous disservice to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: mykidsarecats
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a nice place away from the French Quarter, this is the place! It doesn't look like much on the outside because it looks small, but we had a really nice stay. Our room was clean, quiet and the staff was really friendly. The French Market is right around the corner and the trolley station. There is private gated parking lot. Its a little tricky to enter and exit the lot because the entrance is narrow but not too bad once you get a hang of it. If we make it to N'awlins again, we will once again choose The Frenchman!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynWolfie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 1 year anniversary. It was a great part of town to be for such a short trip. The pool was a great break between bar hopping and listening to amazing live music just steps away. The staff ( especially the maids) were very lovely. The front desk called us a cab many times and was always friendly. It is on Frenchmen Street so there is some action outside (bars, clubs, foot traffic, street music) but that was a plus for us. Also, without even asking, we were given a wonderful room looking out onto the quaint courtyard and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andy982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed the place. I have to say though if you want luxury this is not for you but if you want a good location and value for money I would recommend it. The room was very small and somewhat dated but the double bed was comfortable and the toilet and shower was clean. I have read a number of revues where people complained about the street noise but with the air conditioner on ( and a few beers consumed ) we never found this to be a problem. The staff were friendly and helpful and there is a nice little breakfast laid on in the morning. Its about a 10-15 minute walk from Bourbon St but there is a number of small friendly bars and eateries on the way to stop in to. To be honest we found all the best bars and eateries on the streets around Bourbon St not in Bourbon St anyway. For the price we paid I thought this hotel was good value for money and we would certainly stay again. At the end of the day if your in New Orleans you should not be spending too much time in your hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, safe, affordable, and WONDERFUL location!”
Reviews.Author: HillbillyTightwad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just outside the French Quarter. The rooms are small, but adequate. Room for a queen size bed (which was very comfortable), nightstands, two chest of drawers, closet, and private full bath. It also had a TV and phone. It is decorated in turn of the century decor and very charming. Everything was very clean - only the tub looked out of date, but it was clean. It is not listed as handicapped accessible because there was a 3 inch step up to the room, but we stayed in Room 102 which is a bit bigger than other rooms so I had no trouble negotiating my wheelchair around the room and the bath. We loved the location. We heard great jazz from the streets at all hours of the night after going to bed. It added to our love of the place! The pool and hot tub are situated in the open air courtyard and the area is very inviting. Since the rooms are not large enough for sitting and visiting with others, we used this area instead. On one side of the hotel is a fantastic restaurant, Mojitos, with live music and wonderful food. They have Salsa music every Sunday night with dancing. Beautiful! Around four blocks down the street on the other side of the hotel is a great jazz club, the Spotted Cat, that has live music starting at 3 to 4 in the afternoon continuing into the night.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to experience New Orleans - Music Lovers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Allboys03
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the hottest street in New Orleans there is no place better than the Frenchmen! It is a great B&B on the best street in the city. It has a lovely little pool and great late breakfast. The staff that run the front desk are amazing. There is one word of warning...this place is loud! This street offers 10 live music venues, a five star Zaggat restaurant (Mona's), the best fried chicken in the city (Praline Connection), and several 24 hour bars (Check Point Charlie's), it is a 24 hour party all the time. If you REALLY want to feel New Orleans....stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the price”
Reviews.Author: one30
Reviews.Content: Looking for a place that has the "feel" of New Orleans without feeling ripped off well then this should suit you. Good location on the edge of the French Quarter, and yes the rooms are small and it might not be what you would expect to find as a typical hotel but thats part of its charm. We were only there for a couple of nights so can't comment on some aspects of the housekeeping, but our room was fine. The breakfast was more than adequate for what we needed, and the staff were friendly. All in all it made for a pleasant stay in N.O.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Best Kept Secret...”
Reviews.Author: SarahVier81
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to New Orleans for Mardi Gras. When picking the hotel over the internet we were a little nervous about choosing a good one. We chose the Frenchmen Hotel and couldn't be more please about it!! It is technically a block or less off of the French Quarter, so is in walking distance to everywhere in the French Quarter. We picked a room with a blacony and instead of a door opening onto the blacony they had a window from floor to ceiling...which was just unique! It was a true New Orleans experience at the Frenchmen Hotel. Severly comforatable beds and the room was spotless! The hot tub was a perfect ending to our days of walking! We will be back for Mardi Gras every year and cannot imagine staying anywhere else besides The Frenchmen Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes their lack of service is too much to handle”
Reviews.Author: WJReviewer
Reviews.Content: Please know what you're getting into when you book this hotel. It is small, privately held, and on a very busy street for nightlife. I knew that when I booked. My problem is NOT that my room was right on the street and not really even that there was no sound proofing between the street and my room. I could even see light pushing through the cracks in the door during the day. Sure, the transom has no window treatment and so you get a streetlight unfiltered, keeping the room brighter than the brightest day all night. My problem is with the way parking is administered. They have a VERY SMALL lot and have a first come first served policy. I knew all that. I checked in and was charged $45 for 3 days of parking. No problem. However, the last night, the lot was full, and I was denied parking. The front desk "attendant" told me that someone had parked there illegally. So, I asked her why not have them towed. She replied that the lot was too small to get a tow truck into it (a good hint for anyone who wants to park for free). She sent me to a lot a couple of blocks away. So, I asked her if she was going to refund my parking. No, she wasn't able to do that. Only a manager can do that. At checkout, a new person at the desk. Parking is on my bill. I ask for it to be refunded. Again. Sorry, only managers can do that, and no, she won't get a manager to call me. I can try calling later. So I did. No manager. No message. Next day, another call. No manager. No message. You get the idea. Now, I am calling American Express.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: sorcia88
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it is NOT perfect, but you can'y beat the price and the location...and who wants to sit in the hotel in New Orleans anyway? The staff was amazingly friendly, helpful, and nice...we had to change to the LaMouthe for one night and they carried our luggage there for us.The place has lots of charm and character and I will stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Oh the smells of New Orleans...”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Well, I am not sure if the scent of our loft was due to a deodorizing intended effect, but it smelled like a giant public bathroom. It nearly nauseated me. We stayed here in March 2011, and as I can see its appeal in its character,charm, location, and spaciousness, my priorities lie more in cleanliness, freshness, and comfort. We were upgraded to a loft, which was nice, I suppose. However, that then meant that we had to walk a narrow staircase downstairs to the restroom in the night. The living area downstairs, though, could be a perfect place to entertain guests, if that is what you want to do. And if you happened to be attending an event at the club next door, perfect location. I don't want to sound picky, but there were several hairs all over in the bathroom; the tub did not drain, yuk!, and well, that smell. We did sleep well, so maybe those lofts in the back by the pool are quieter. However, I have stayed at a much more pleasant hotel before called the Dauphine Orleans. It has the same charm, better really, and much much cleaner and presentable. There was not even room for us to park there at The Frenchmen because it was full, so their parking does not even accommodate their own guests. Strange. I DID like that they monitor who comes in and out of the hotel. Safe, I suppose. The breakfast left much much to be desired. It was very simple and really not even attended to. Cereal was spilling from the canister. Cereals, toast, and doughnuts, along with coffee, juice, and milk were offered. Very simple. No croissants or biscuits or fruit or something special or extra even slightly was offered. Oh, and the pool looked pretty, but too cool still to swim. So, I thought the hot tub could be an option, but it was not hot or even warm at all. Would I stay there again? Naaah.... but for those folks with different priorities may really enjoy it. It was roomy indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience, this time.”
Reviews.Author: rwillison
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by stating that I have stayed at the Frenchman 5 times before, more than 15 years ago. Each of those visits to this great old hotel with tons of charm were great. Obviously I was more than pleased with our past experiences. Now for this trip. The hotel has not changed in the least. They have the same decor and room layout, right down to the furniture and paint. We arrived exactly 13 days prior to Marti Gras, and were happy to find that nothing had changed since our last visit. Upon entering the room, the bathroom floor was wet, obviously from a recent mopping, still so very dirty that our feet and socks were literally black after only a visit to the sink and back. The bathroom sink would not drain, even after just a few seconds of running. 2 of the 3 light bulbs in the main light fixture over the bed were burned out. Closing the bathroom door from the inside left us standing with the handle in our hand and not in the door. The towels were pretty frayed and left lots of strings after use. When the air conditioner cycled down, it shook and rattled the entire mounting. Despite these things, the evening was quiet and spent in a nice atmosphere. The next night (Friday) the guests upstairs arrived. Crashing and banging above us was the entertainment for the evening (until 4am). Still, our spirits were great (it is New Orleans, after all). Saturday night, as the crashing and banging continued, I finally went to the front desk, where I was told that they would speak with the people upstairs. If it didn't stop, we could simply call the office and they would take further action. After about 30 minutes of drifting off to well needed sleep, the moving of furniture, drawer bang and whatever continued. Back to the office. This time we were told that the person above us had a wooden leg. REALLY? The night attendant apologized for the inconvenience, but nothing was done (I guess at this point I was the problem). We asked for simply a different room just to sleep though the night (there were open rooms), we were told there were none available. Sunday night. Repeat performance of the previous two nights. Finally at 4:15, we decided to leave for the rest of the night (again, this is New Orleans after all). Monday, after I asked the day attendant for a different room, we were told that the guests above had been moved to another room. The attendant was not aware of our problems the previous nights, but apologized profusely for our plight. A great night of blissful sleep. Would I stay here again, maybe. The location is great. You can't get better atmosphere in N.O. The staff is pleasant, just not fully trained in handling what was seemingly a simple fix (just move to an empty room). The cleanliness had a lot to be desired. I keep reading many of the other reviews here and even did so before I returned after such a long absence. I am not recommending anything here, This place is great in so many ways, but could be even better with very little capital and effort put forward.

Reviews.Title: “Best location anywhere in the city”
Reviews.Author: Spitcurl
Reviews.Content: There are only three things you really need from a hotel in New Orleans: 1) a good location; 2) an oasis from the street scene, crowds, and noise to decompress in after a long day; and 3) a 24-hour front desk. Anything else is cake. This is a city for going out, not staying in! The location is unbeatable. The scene on Frenchman St. is very different from the strip club & go-cup scene at the other end of Bourbon, but it is in many ways more lively and more interesting, without so many clumsy drunks. Great music, incredible food, and right off Decatur so only a block or two from the French Quarter. It can be a bit festive on Frenchman St. -- we went two weekends before Mardis Gras, so that is part of it, but we also heard punk & hard rock as early as 9am on a Monday from the bar across the street. But only once we stepped outside the hotel -- from our room in the back, behind the courtyard, it was peaceful. That was just the way we liked it -- adventures outside, sanctuary inside. We picked a 2-floor loft room (got #212), and always had a place to hide and nap before dinner and going out again. Our room was painted PURPLE and covered in Erte, Pinup girl & Absinthe artwork -- it was like they knew we were coming! They are undergoing renovations, so some things were brand new (furniture, art, etc.) and some things were older (bathroom doorknob, a/c). The rooms were not sprawling. But give them a break -- this is an older building in post-Katrina NOLA, and a private local business! There are dozens of chain or swanky boutique hotels in the Quarter and downtown if you want more space and services. I would advise splurging for the Lofts or Suites if you can swing it -- they are still cheaper than standard rooms elsewhere, and have more space to stretch out. Complimentary sherry around 5pm. Continental breakfast that was average, but good for a cup of coffee and a snack before heading out for a big brunch (Clover Grill, Cake Cafe, Stanley's). Cafe du Monde is just down the street. Unless I were on a romantic honeymoon-type getaway and wanted something really plush like room service and an in-room hot tub, I would stay here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT my hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoodieloo
Reviews.Content: My man and I visited New Orleans in January for a quick two night stay. I had researched a long time to find the right hotel ,and decided on the Frenchman because of the great location and that the room I rented was a suite with a living room and a balcony. I had read a lot of good reviews and discredited a few bad ones. At first I only booked one night , in a suite through Bookit.com, and planned to stay the first night at my friends guest house few blocks away in the Marigny . A day after I booked our room on the Bookit.com website ,I decided to book our first night there as well and went directly to the Frenchmen's website , I found the same room available(for $20.00 more), and so I booked it for our first night too. When we arrived at the hotel we were put in room 200. It was a lovely room but it did not have a living area as pictured and promised. I went down to the desk and let them know and even showed them proof on their own website. I just kept being told that that was a suite and that I would need to speak to the manager tomorrow about it. Well, the next day we called Bookit.com and they called the hotel and let them know that they needed to move us to a suite,and we were moved to a suite albeit a MUCH dumpier room , In spite of it all being there in black and white to see they just chose to call a single,small, room with only a bed and a bathroom( and large walk through windows that did not lock) a suite. *see review titled "do not stay in room 200",in which the management did not call 200 a suite. Upon leaving I suggested that perhaps they should change the description and the pictures on their website and it appears that at least they have now changed it. I am often impressed when a manager responds to a complaint on these reviews, thinking that it indicates that they really do look after things and care,however if that were the case they should have fixed it then,rather then apologize later. My friend had wanted me to stay free in her guest house but I wanted to stay in in this "quaint/funky" hotel which ultimately did us wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Balcony and view.”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyNurse73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. My first stay was in a single room, and the room was very small. My second stay was in a suite, and it was wonderful. Proximity to the quarter is great.

Reviews.Title: “Meet me on Frenchmen Street!”
Reviews.Author: WhereNextNYC
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has been staying here for years and now I know why. It is a gem of New Orleans. Frenchmen street is the place to hear bands of all kinds in NOLA yet the bars are a couple of blocks down from the hotel so you don't hear the revelry. It's clean, quaint and makes walking the French Quarter all the easier knowing you have the Frenchmen to go back to. This is the only place I'll stay in New Orleans from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Its got soul.”
Reviews.Author: LimousineBaxter
Reviews.Content: Though for the second year in a row our bed has collapsed on us (and we weren't even doing anything that acrobatic!), we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Far enough away from the tackiness of Bourbon Street, it is located on an energetic street lined with some of the best bars and music venues in the city. The rooms have exposed brick and are small but very cozy and comfortable (aside from our reoccurring mattress problem). The pool and hot tub are a great way to unwind after a day of sightseeing before hitting the bars. The staff is knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. It just feels like the non-tourists answer to a New Orleans hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 200”
Reviews.Author: rachnbach
Reviews.Content: Front door slammed constantly (actually shaking the bed/building/room) from about 4 AM on. No sleep for these travelers. There were also all sorts of truck noises on street outside window (room 200 faces the front) THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. No sleep despite our "white noise machine". No hot water in sink so had to wash face in cold water. Dust bunnies on wall next to heater. Mattresses was comfortable though, even if we couldn't sleep. My husband researched for a long time to find a suite. It was our 20th anniversary celebration. He finally settled on the Frenchmen when he was promised (and prepaid) for the King suite. Upon check-in, we were told that the heater was broken in the King suite and that we would be given a room on the front by the street. The staff was friendly, though, and we had free wifi .... it's just that you pay for a hotel to sleep. If only for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Frenchmen, this was our third stay and we'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: SB_Pyrat
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at The Frenchmen for the past three years and absolutely love it. We tried a few different hotels before discovering The Frenchmen. It truly has been our home away from home the past three trips to New Orleans. We get the balcony suites, which are really awesome. The hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. It's right down the street from Margaritaville and one of our new favorite places, Turtle Bay. I would give The Frenchmen my highest recommendation if you're looking for a great hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Price, Great Location and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LeeMunns
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say... A excellent hotel was very clean the people on the desk were more than helpfull and the location was excellent as forget Bourbon Street this end of town is far better, unless you like college kids pucking in the street and paying $6 a bottle of beer. A nice little pool too that is great for chilling by before you head off to bed The room we had was excellent far beyond that was expecting bed was the comfy I have ever splent in, only downside was no curtains as such and can get a little light in the mornings. But staff said they are going to fix this for my return trip next year. I can not praise this hotel enough, I am going back for Halloween again next year and there is only 1 place I will be staying and that is here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: olinjeely
Reviews.Content: Although I've NEVER had a bad experience in NOLA, My stay at Frenchmen hotel was the BEST New Orleans stay, It's location is perfect for the best live music venues that cover both sides of the Street, but no worries its VERY quite & comfortable, Great Beds, and incredible Staff, I'm a world traveller and have dont write reviews but this place is my favorite stay in a GREAT Town!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old is one thing...... dirty another”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of location and free parking. I did not expect much and thats what I got. While it was adequate, the bathroom was disgusting. Old I can handle....... dirty I can not. When I checked in the front desk person was rude. Upon departure much nicer. Spend a little more and feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay with friendly Staff, quaint rooms and good location.”
Reviews.Author: cowellp1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10/30/10 - 11/02/10. We were in town for Halloween, so as you can imagine we were pretty excited anyway. But from the moment we walked in the lobby to the time we left, the friendly and courteous service was the best part of the trip and the most impressive. The room was perfect, we stayed in #108 a King bed. Clean and well maintained, the maid always left new towels even when we had do not disturb. All the staff had great knowledge of the town, where to go, eat, drink and where to avoid. In all the times i have been to New Orleans i had never been to this part of the French Quarter, but I will from now on and will be staying at the Frenchmen:) A very special thanks to; Front Desk - Kaneesha Front Desk - Eugina Housekeeping - Delisha Houseman - Keith Front Desk mgr - Marianne If I spelt your names wrong i apologize, you are a credit to your Hotel and give a definite sense of pride in your work. Paul Cowell and Tiffany Johns Hernando, Ms.

Reviews.Title: “The best neighborhood to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: dotave
Reviews.Content: The people who work here are so sweet. We really enjoyed our stay. There's a party by the pool late night so ask for a room upstairs if you mind noise. The rooms are small and a little run down but who stays in a room in New Orleans? Frenchmen st. has better music and food than commercial bourbon st. and the French market is just steps away. We were here for Halloween and are planing to come back every year. Next year we will spring for a suite at the frenchmen.

Reviews.Title: “Leaky Roof!”
Reviews.Author: burana22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Frenchmen Hotel. However when it rained our room leaked horribly and we had to change rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful, bathrooms were clean, but I strongly recommend asking for a renovated room. My sister and her husband did and were just fine. It's in the French Quarter so it was convenient to the main streets.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Style... New World Charm”
Reviews.Author: NavymanBirmingham_Al
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the property, we were glad to see that is located away from all the hustle and crowds of the French Quarters but close enough to walk to anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel will make you think you went back in time... charming, clean, freindly management and relaxing are the words I would use to describe it. I will be back! The rooms were large enough and the price was the best value in New Orleans. The staff and mamagement were helpful when we asked for things to visit and places to eat, they know the city well and were eager to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Always 1st choice!”
Reviews.Author: D-Yellow
Reviews.Content: My family and i were planning a trip to New Orleans and the Frenchman Hotel was everyones choice in where to stay. So when we arrived in the afternoon, the service desk greeted us friendly and showed us where our rooms would be. The rooms had plenty of space for everyone to relax in and was very comfortable. Not only were the rooms nice, but the location of the building is great. You have delecious eateries and attractions where ever you turn and even the sightings from out of your window is amazing. The hotel is an attraction all in its own. The charm and history will make you feel as if you always belonged there. I would definitely be coming back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously? This place has changed... FOR THE BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diamondambitions
Reviews.Content: We checked in this weekend for the Saints vs. Atlanta game. We were here last year and can tell a major difference! We have room 300 a suite which has been so spacious and inviting. There are fresh flowers in the room and we had champagne waiting on us. Last year we stayed here and were horrified! The rooms were dark and unkept. The manager we came in contact with last year seemed like he was drunk and didn't care about our concerns. WHAT A DIFFERENCE! Let me tell everyone: THIS PLACE HAS CHANGED! The front desk staff is amazing and Kenesha is a doll! She is the manager of guest satisfaction and rightfully so. I don't know what's going on here but KEEP IT UP! We will definitley return! New Orleans is an awesome city and the Frenchmen is an awesome place to witness all the fun.

Reviews.Title: “Mistake staying here”
Reviews.Author: irishprces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Frenchman the end of August. We were disappointed in the staff, they were cold and made us feel that we were bothering them. The rooms were small which was fine except we ended up sharing with the roaches for control over the bathroom. The only good thing about the room was the bed was comfortable. There breakfast consisted of donuts or bread for toasting some coffee and that was it, I received better in bed and breakfasts. The price was not worth it. I should have booked the Holiday Inn on Royal for less, at least I know what I would be getting. I have stayed in New Orleans over the years in may different places and this by far in the bottom of the list.

Reviews.Title: “We will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: redfeathermama
Reviews.Content: We travel to NO 1-2 times per year. My first experience with the Frenchman was during June 2009 when I had traveled alone for the first time to visit our son who lives in NO. He recommended it to me for its location and security as I would have days when he would be at work. It was an excellent choice for a woman traveling alone. It is convenient for daily walks to the French Market and wonderful restaurants are right outside the door! We brought our other adult children as well as an infant this May-June. The prices were affordable and rooms were clean., Breakfast was good and certainly was a money saver for a the 6 of us! There were spaces where the whole family could gather (dogs included!). The most outstanding part of the visit however was the staff. These people made us feel welcome and certainly took care of all of our needs. Parking is ever a problem in the quarter, although there is off street parking ( limited and very tight), but once again staff worked to meet our needs. This Hotel does not offer glamor or glitz but it does offer New Orleans charm and staff that are as friendly and as helpful as you will find anywhere! We definitely found a new home in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let appearances throw you. The Frenchmen will grow on you.”
Reviews.Author: stellarmagnitude
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Frenchmen, I have to say I was disappointed. BUT we've never stayed in a hotel that wasn't part of a chain... Pros: * Close to everything, but not so much that you are bothered by raucous nightclubs, etc. * Securely locked down at night * Pet friendly! (Had we known this beforehand, we would've brought our dog along!) * Charming and unique * Great price! (We got our room, Room 207, for about $60 a night including tax) * Very comfortable bed Cons: * Pool appeared unkempt upon arrival, but they worked on that :-) * The noise level from other guests was a little too much, especially in the mornings * Tiny bathroom/shower * The covered parking is very small. It was a tight fit for our little Saturn coupe. * Some of the things in the room didn't work well -- the bathroom doorknob, the TV remote and the ceiling fan. In the end, the hotel felt more and more like home each day. This place has personality and will grow on you after a few days! If you don't intend on staying holed up in your room for your entire stay (and who would?), it's perfect! We are already planning on returning.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in an awesome city!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang S
Reviews.Content: Perfect situtated in the french Quarter, where everyday is a saturday night!!! i would like to stay the rest of my days! Its good to hop into the pool, in this hot city. In walking distance is the world famous Bourbon Street, with bars and restaurants and party all the time. A locked parking lot is for an extra fee available.After a little breakfast you are good to go for museums, the ferry to mardi gras center and lots of other things in this most amazing place in the US (world?!?)!!

Reviews.Title: “This is where to stay if your wanting great Food, Jazz and Drink. Its all on Frenchmen St.”
Reviews.Author: GhostCowboy
Reviews.Content: A quick trip out of town with my girlfriend while her son visited dad for spring break and wow tit urned out to be a top 3 trip of all time. We met friends that were there on business 30 minutes after arriving and they showed up with Bourbon and cokes in the to go cups you can get at any bar. We never slowed down from the start and after a few bars on Frenchmen we hit Adolfo's for some great Italian seafood. We had a few more drinks at the bar downstairs the Apple Barrel due to the 30-45min wait for Adolfo's, but well worth the wait. We meet some local musicians while at the Apple Barrel which my girlfriend is now friends with on F.B. You wont get this on Bourbon St. After dinner we hit the Spotted Cat and enjoyed some of the best live Jazz in the world. What a first night. Back to the hotel, its old, clean and great staff. Basic coffee and donuts for breakfast but who are you kidding, you don't eat breakfast at your hotel with beignets and world famous coffee houses like Cafe Du Monde right down the road. The next two days are blurry which included St. Patricks day and the parades. Watch the Irish guys around your women, They hand out more than beads, LOL! Dennies Seafood, Harrahs Casino and Central Grocery for a Muffuletta, Acme Oyster House with some great bars mixed in as we walked. we even got the girls to go to one of NOLAs famous mammary viewing establishments, hell they may have had a better time than the guys! We did walk every where from The Frenchmens location. The French Market is only two blocks away, try their Bloody Marys while your shopping! More about the Hotel, I think it may be haunted, I took pictures of the Suite we stayed in which was a free upgrade since we booked a regular room,There appear to be orbs in some of the pics. It has that feeling of old New Orleans, this is definitely the side of town to stay on!

Reviews.Title: “Confused about all the wonderful reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hedwig
Reviews.Content: Before I write a negative review, I want to say that this is a great location if you want to hear music on Frenchmen Street. Also, the price is extremely reasonable. We stayed here for one night; (we had reservations elsewhere for the rest of our trip. ) I really am not that hard to please, but I thought the room was horrible. Because everything was so old (NOT with antiques) it didn't look very clean, just extremely shabby. Also, the mattress was terrible--it sloped so that we both ended up in the middle of it. The front door to our room didn't work; we notified the office personnel and it was going to be fixed. When we returned, the door was wide open with all our belongings available to whoever would want them. We would never stay here again. However, a single male friend who was traveling with us stayed there for the week. He didn't mind it. (He is used to doing a lot of camping in the wilderness and going to festivals where he is in ankle deep mud.) What he enjoyed were the free bottles of water, coffee, and fruit available all day long. They also serve brandy in the late afternoon. He WOULD stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place!”
Reviews.Author: Breadbird
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if chain hotels and motels are your preference, but the Frenchmen Hotel is funky and different and very comfortable. Our room opened onto the courtyard (at least it was once a courtyard I guess ... now it is the pool) and although some of the guests sat by the pool until midnight or so chatting, we had no real problems with noise and were not bothered by bad music from local clubs - and we are seniors who go to bed early and appreciate our creature comforts. Perhaps it depends where your room is in the facility. The Hotel's location is phenomenal and excellent value given the cost of accommodation in the French Quarter. The experience is somewhat European, the staff are friendly and helpful and there are tons of interesting things to do within walking distance. Since we were driving we particularly appreciated the parking (limited, but available). The breakfast was good, too. I have already recommended this charming place to others, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy trying to sleep at ROCK CONCERTS this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: jacoso
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel before booking. A couple of these reviews discussed the noise levels at this hotel, particularly the noise from the bar across the street. In spite of the reveiws, I decided that I would reserve a room anyway and give it a try. I arrived exhausted after an 11 hour drive at 2:30 am. The noise from the clubs and street was extreme. It was as if the band had set up in the middle of my hotel room. The light that shone from the street was very bright in the room. The band did not stop playing until around 4:00 am. Needless to say, I did not get any rest. Sunday night was a littlle better, but I was awakened by the street cleaner and by a garbage truck at 4:00 am. There was also a fire station about 20 yards away and I could hear the radio communication. This hotel is very noisy. When I called to make the reservation I asked the clerk, Kenisha, about the reviews (noise levels) and she stated that it was "not that bad...It doesn't bother me". Evidently, she does not sleep at the hotel since she is a first shift clerk. THE NOISE IS THAT BAD! Even without the noise, this hotel is not worth the the price that I paid (and this was a reduced rate of 99.00 +tax= 113.00 per night). The hotel is damp, dark and dank because it is old. I really don't understand the great reviews posted concerning this hotel. I am not pretentious or upscale in my taste at all. I am easily pleased with cleanliness, friendly service and a fair price. The hotel was marginal on all of these accounts. The only positive about the hotel is the location. If you are going to New Orleans to party into the wee hours of the morning and to sleep very little, then this is the hotel for you. I also realize that the management does not take responsiblity for customer conplaints that are part of the reviews. There is always an excuse, or an attempt to discount or discredit the reviewer. I feel like I had been "had", so to speak. I got that feeling about the city of New Orleans, in general. Seemed that everywhere I turned someone was attempting to squeeze a dollar, I had really expected more from this city. After a full day and two nights of this hotel and the City of New Orleans, I felt that I could not peel the scum off of my flesh with a set of pliers. The only real enjoyable aspect of the trip was a band that played at the Krazy Korner on Bourbon Street, several street performers, the roadfest food festival, and the Cafe du Monde. I have never been so happy to leave a city or a hotel. New Orleans has lost it's real authenticity, and is nothing more than a commercialized, superficial, oversized, sleazy beer joint. The whole city is a greedy, money grubbing sleaze joint. The police officers are very rude also. I would not only never return to this hotel, but I also have no plans to ever return to this city.

Reviews.Title: “great location - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kelly78209
Reviews.Content: location was great - easy access to french quarter and lots of local music clubs in the immediate area. rooms are small and do not have a fridge or a safe in the room. lots of noise from trains and people coming in an out - lol - there was light coming in from around our door - so noise came in as well. bathrooms are small but functional . toilet was loose on floor as was bathroom sink faucet. Shower stall was not clean and the shower curtin rod kept falling even after mentioning this to staff. Staff was very helpful BUT the owner needs to let loose on some funds to make this a tru french quater gem. had a nice breakfast avilable in the morning for us.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been quieter sleeping on an airport runway.”
Reviews.Author: Canetrain
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a little more room than our matchbox apt here in New York. Ich don't think so. Small room. Wish I had brought a skateboard to ride the halfpipe that was the bed. Back breaker. Very neat though. Was decorated very nicely. The day staff (Keisha) was very helpful and made us feel very welcome. The night staff however couldn't organize a [--] up in a brewery. I guess watching the TV was more important than helping the guests. The main issue I had was the fact that this new bar/club (VASO) has opened opposite the hotel and they pump Music through a PA system larger than Madison Square Garden's. The Hotel needs to sort this out to save its good reputation. I am still hallucinating 2 days after leaving from lack of sleep and I promise you it was not the Hurricanes. Good place to stay if your an Owl. Should have saved my Hand-grenade for the Vaso!!! I

Reviews.Title: “The Jekyll and Hyde of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: glmwny
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Frenchmen with my boyfriend, and several other family members also had rooms there. This place is decent by day; cute old house on a hip street known for great music, the rooms were nothing special but had period furniture and an authentic feel, the shower was literally a stand-up stall but it is New Orleans, we didn't plan to spend too much time in our room other than sleeping. Therein lies the problem. A new club has evidently opened within the past month DIRECTLY across the street from this old house converted into a hotel. I would not wish the sleep experience we had there on my worst enemy. At about 12 every night, this HORRIBLE music began. It wasn't jazz, it wasn't rock, I couldn't discern vocals, and there was no break - i.e, it wasn't songs just loud, horrible ongoing music!!!! Like a marching band. It was so loud that things in our room were vibrating - no lie. I tried earplugs, pillows on my head, turning the fan on - this club (VASO was the name) was unbearable. Sunday Vaso was closed - however the room (101) was still quite really noisy. You could hear the front door slamming all night, and folks coming home after a night out. Icing on the cake is the bed we nicknamed the "half-pipe" - it was so overly soft that we rolled into the middle. Not nice. So, my suggestion is if you are planning on staying out until 3 or 4 a.m., go ahead and stay here. Otherwise, DO NOT STAY HERE until they tell you that Vaso has been shut down. It is well worth the extra money to actually be able to sleep more than a few hours a night. Finally, the day clerk, Keesha, was really helpul, lovely and kind but the night clerk couldn't be bothered to even give us the time of day or get us towels.

Reviews.Title: “And the Band Played On...Don't Plan to Sleep Between 1:00AM and 4:00AM”
Reviews.Author: WWEIBLE
Reviews.Content: You pretty much get what you pay for at the Frenchmen. We paid under $100/night. As such our expectations were pretty low coming in. Our room was OK...the decor was neat...definately felt like you were staying at an old NOLA inn. The bed was OK...a little used and not at all firm. The bath was a bit rough; I've had better showers at campgrounds. I would not complain about the cleanliness of the room/bath taking into account what they have to work with here. Our whole group was very dissappointed with the EXTREMELY LOUD NIGHTCLUB ACROSS THE STREET. Apparently a club (Vaso) just opened up. This place is an after hours joint that hosts some of the worst bands in New Orleans. Unfortunately the Frenchmen is not well soundproofed. We tried everything to drown out the noise (air conditioner, bathroom fan, even AM radio static), but to no avail. It sounded like the bands were playing in our hotel room. Impossible to sleep! One of our party actually bought earplugs after the first night, and could still hear the band. It was so loud the second night that it actually became laughable to us. Do not expect to sleep between 1AM and 4AM!!! The hotel owner needs to do something about Vaso. If you take the unbearable noise out of the equation, this hotel is not a bad option all things considered if your budget is $100/night. Until then I would look elsewhere if you plan to sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back and simple!”
Reviews.Author: SamiaGoes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here this past march, and i really consider this hotel an up and coming gem.
